intro: Artemisia santonicum, commonly known as the Indian wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-green foliage and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant contains volatile oils, including santonicin, which contribute to its distinctive scent and medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a valuable species in traditional medicine and horticulture.
